mods.abstract: $75 REWARD. I WILL give $25 reward each for the apprehension and delivery at the jail of this Parish, or to their owners with their acknowledgment of the same, of the following slaves who made their escape from the jail of this Parish, on the 14th inst. To-wit; - A negro man named ALBERT, belong to R.L. Tanner, Esq., about six feet high, black, and about 26 years old. The other two, MAT and WILLIAM, belonging to Robt. Irion, of Avoyells. MAT is about 5 feet, 10 inches high, dark Mulatto, WILLIAM is about 5 feet, 8 inches high, black and stout built. Sheriff's Office, Alexandria, La., Aug. 17th 1860. W.J. NEAL, Sheriff. aug20-tf
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
